intro: Matelea macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. The fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
